Posted By: TheSwarm (5/1/2011 5:52:37 PM)

posts.post_content:
I just realized each of the Praetors seems to have a "signature spell", a la the M11 planeswalkers.  
  
Elesh Norn - [Norn's Annex](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Norn's Annex)  
Jin-Gitaxias - [Gitaxian Probe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gitaxian Probe)  
Sheoldred - [Reaper of Sheoldred](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reaper of Sheoldred)  
Urabrask - [Priest of Urabrask](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Priest of Urabrask)  
Vorinclex - this is the iffy one. Unlike the other four, nothing else in the block has his name in it ... but guess which green sorcery showed up in Mirrodin Beseiged that actually **shows** Vorinclex in its art?  
  
That's right. [Praetors' Counsel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Praetors' Counsel). Which just happens to be much more affordable with the big guy's ramping ability.  
  
Edit: On the other hand, Praetors' Counsel might make more sense as part of an art-cycle with [Marrow Shards](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Marrow Shards), [Psychic Surgery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Psychic Surgery), [Praetor's Grasp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Praetor's Grasp), and [Act of Aggression](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Act of Aggression), in which case Vorinclex doesn't have a "named" spell.
posts.html:
I just realized each of the Praetors seems to have a "signature spell", a la the M11 planeswalkers.

Elesh Norn - Norn's Annex
Jin-Gitaxias - Gitaxian Probe
Sheoldred - Reaper of Sheoldred
Urabrask - Priest of Urabrask
Vorinclex - this is the iffy one. Unlike the other four, nothing else in the block has his name in it ... but guess which green sorcery showed up in Mirrodin Beseiged that actually shows Vorinclex in its art?

That's right. Praetors' Counsel. Which just happens to be much more affordable with the big guy's ramping ability.

Edit: On the other hand, Praetors' Counsel might make more sense as part of an art-cycle with Marrow Shards, Psychic Surgery, Praetor's Grasp, and Act of Aggression, in which case Vorinclex doesn't have a "named" spell.

Posted By: Kryptnyt (4/29/2011 6:32:24 PM)

posts.post_content:
I love all of the praetors in this cycle - they are dripping with flavour, and I've been waiting since they were first hinted at on Scars cards' flavour text to get a glimpse of these legendary Phyrexians. Most of Phyrexia's legendary creatures in the past have been converts from the local populace that's being invaded ([Ertai, the Corrupted](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ertai, the Corrupted), [Ascendant Evincar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ascendant Evincar), [Glissa, the Traitor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glissa, the Traitor)); [Tsabo Tavoc](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tsabo Tavoc) has stood alone in this regard for a long time.   
  
The flavour this cycle shares is an absolute home run in my books. I've heard many times that Vorinclex is the weakest one, as green already has good fatties, and a mana flare is "win-more" when you're at 8 mana already; that may all be true, but even if he is the weakest of the praetors, I still believe his ability is quite strong.   
  
@TerraTron:  
  
While both Vorinclex and [War's Toll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=War's Toll) would be annoying to face down in EDH/Commander, they don'... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I love all of the praetors in this cycle - they are dripping with flavour, and I've been waiting since they were first hinted at on Scars cards' flavour text to get a glimpse of these legendary Phyrexians. Most of Phyrexia's legendary creatures in the past have been converts from the local populace that's being invaded (Ertai, the Corrupted, Ascendant Evincar, Glissa, the Traitor); Tsabo Tavoc has stood alone in this regard for a long time.

The flavour this cycle shares is an absolute home run in my books. I've heard many times that Vorinclex is the weakest one, as green already has good fatties, and a mana flare is "win-more" when you're at 8 mana already; that may all be true, but even if he is the weakest of the praetors, I still believe his ability is quite strong.

posts.post_content: People keep saying that the mana flare is underwhelming on something that costs 8, and they're right. People also keep saying that green has plenty of other beatsticks, and they're right about that, too. But everyone seems to ignore the effect he has on opponents-- Sure, it's not a total lockdown, but it's still extremely brutal. That's the real purpose of the card: The flare and the 7/6 trample body are just nice extras.
posts.html:

People also keep saying that green has plenty of other beatsticks, and they're right about that, too. But everyone seems to ignore the effect he has on opponents-- Sure, it's not a total lockdown, but it's still extremely brutal. That's the real purpose of the card: The flare and the 7/6 trample body are just nice extras.

posts.post_content:
What about pairing this guy up with White Sun's Zenith or Red Sun's Zenith? Neither are in color, to be sure, but they're nice things to do with the mana. You'd get at least 13 2/2 cats, or do at least 15 damage (assuming you paid 8 to get Vorinclex).  
  
Granted, not a tourney quality ability (it takes a while to get this guy out, and if they have any sort of removal at all, you're screwed), but it's nice in casual or EDH to try the sun's zenith combo.
posts.html:
